sn55.31:4.2: “Mendicants, there are these four kinds of overflowing merit, overflowing goodness that nurture happiness.
sn55.31:4.4: Firstly, a noble disciple has experiential confidence in the Buddha …
sn55.31:4.7: This is the first kind of overflowing merit, overflowing goodness that nurtures happiness.
sn55.31:5.1: Furthermore, a noble disciple has experiential confidence in the Dharma …
sn55.31:5.4: This is the second kind of overflowing merit, overflowing goodness that nurtures happiness.
sn55.31:6.1: Furthermore, a noble disciple has experiential confidence in the Saṅgha …
sn55.31:6.4: This is the third kind of overflowing merit, overflowing goodness that nurtures happiness.
sn55.31:7.1: Furthermore, a noble disciple’s ethical conduct is loved by the noble ones, unbroken, unflawed, unblemished, untainted, liberating, praised by sensible people, not mistaken, and leading to samādhi.
sn55.31:7.3: This is the fourth kind of overflowing merit, overflowing goodness that nurtures happiness.
sn55.31:7.4: These are the four kinds of overflowing merit, overflowing goodness that nurture happiness.”
